Frank McCown wrote:
>
> Sorry for my newbie question- I am attempting to modify Heritrix
> (obtained from heritrix-1.9.0-200607171747-src.tar.gz) using Eclipse
> 3.1. I've successfully imported and re-built Heritrix, but now I'm
> wondering how to get it to run.
>
> I saw in the developer's manual the bit about setting the
> 'heritrix.development' property, but it's not clear as to where this
> property should be set.
>









Right-click on the org.archive.crawler.Heritrix class.  Select 'Debug 
as...' --> 'Java Application..'.

This will try and run the Heritrix main.  It'll fail.

Next go under the 'Run' menu and select 'Debug'.  Look for the 'Run 
Configuration' that was just made by the above action.  It'll be named 
'Heritrix' in the left hand list.  Select it (Its probably preselected 
since its last debug run). 

See the tabs.  Click on 'Arguments'.  There are two places to fill in 
arguments.  There are application arguments and JVM arguments.  I 
usually put into the top textbox '--run' so I don't have to go to the 
extra step of setting this in the UI.  The lower textbox is where you 
set '-Dheritrix.development' system property.


> Can I still use the
> ~/heritrix-1.9.0-200607171747/src/scripts/heritrix script to start up
> Heritrix without having to make major modifications due to the fact that
> files are in different locations?
>






Please try again.  I'm not sure I understand what you are asking.  Is 
there a special modification you've made to the heritrix wrapper script 
you need to happen when eclipse starts Heritrix?  Which files are you 
referring to?

When running in eclipse, we'll let it launch Heritrix.  Depending on 
what it is that you are debugging, you may need to reproduce in eclipse 
a few of the settings made by the heritrix wrapper script (e.g. setup of 
JMX Agent system properties) but this is the exception since most 
Heritrix configuration is done via the UI and the Heritrix UI is 
available to you when running in eclipse.

Good luck.
St.Ack

















>
> Thanks,
> Frank
>
>
